meanings.definition: To take great pleasure or delight in something.
meanings.sent1: The children reveled in the colorful fireworks display.
meanings.sent2: She reveled in the beauty of the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The puppy reveled in chasing its tail around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The artist reveled in the freedom of expression on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The audience reveled in the music, clapping and cheering enthusiastically.

meanings.definition: To engage in lively and noisy festivities or celebrations.
meanings.sent1: The town reveled in the annual carnival, with music and dancing filling the streets.
meanings.sent2: They reveled in the New Year's Eve party, laughing and singing together.
meanings.sent3: The family reveled in the birthday party, playing games and sharing stories.
meanings.sent4: The fans reveled in the victory, waving flags and chanting in joy.
meanings.sent5: The community reveled in the parade, with colorful floats and marching bands.
